org.dellroad.muxable

Interface MuxableChannel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Channel, Closeable

    public interface MuxableChannel
extends Channel
    A single channel supporting parallel nested byte-oriented channels operating independently.

    The nested "child" channels are byte-oriented and operate independently, and all scoped to the parent MuxableChannel. In other words, if a parent is closed, all of its nested channels are also implicitly closed; on the other hand, if a nested channel is closed, only that nested channel is affected, and its parent and siblings are unaffected.

    Any exception implies brokenness: if a MuxableChannel or any nested channel throws IOException, one should assume it (the channel that threw the exception) is no longer usable and should be closed.

    Deadlock Requirements

    Implementations may use varying strategies for multiplexing the nested channels over the underlying "real" channel, and this may have subtle effects on behavior. For example, with implementations that multiplex over a single underlying TCP stream, there may be situations where, after certain internal buffer limits are reached, further attempts to read from nested channel A will block unless and until more data is read from a sibling nested channel B, etc. Nested channels might also block if the BlockingQueue returned by getNestedChannelRequests() reaches its internal buffer capacity, etc. In any case, such restrictions or limitations should be clearly documented by the implementation.

    However, all implementations must avoid "senseless deadlock"; more precisely: if, for every nested input channel along with the BlockingQueue returned by getNestedChannelRequests(), there exists some Thread or Selector currently polling for data, and there is any data is available, then at least one must become readable and provide new data.

    • Method Detail

      • newNestedChannelRequest

        NestedChannelRequest newNestedChannelRequest(ByteBuffer requestData,
                                             Directions directions)
                                      throws IOException
        Create a new nested channel, or pair of nested channels, scoped to this instance.

        The remote side will be notified by the appearance of a corresponding NestedChannelRequest in the queue returned by getNestedChannelRequests() (with the input and output channels reversed, of course). The delivery of requests on the remote side is guaranteed to preserve order (but only to the extent order is well-defined on the sending side, i.e., there is a "happens before" relationship).

        Parameters:
        requestData - data to supply to the remote side (via NestedChannelRequest.getRequestData())
        directions - which of input and/or output to create
        Returns:
        the newly created nested channel(s)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if either parameter is null

      • newNestedChannelRequest

        default NestedChannelRequest newNestedChannelRequest(ByteBuffer requestData)
                                              throws IOException
        Create a pair of nested input and output channels scoped to this instance.

        Equivalent to: newNestedChannelRequest(requestData, Directions.BIDIRECTIONAL).

        Parameters:
        requestData - data to supply to the remote side (via NestedChannelRequest.getRequestData())
        Returns:
        the newly created nested channel(s)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if requestData is null

      • getNestedChannelRequests

        BlockingQueue<NestedChannelRequest> getNestedChannelRequests()
        Access the queue of incoming NestedChannelRequests initiated from the remote side.

        Each NestedChannelRequest corresponds to a remote invocation of newNestedChannelRequest(). Moreover, the order of requests is preserved.

        Note: no special change happens to the returned BlockingQueue once this instance is closed; instead, new reqeusts simply stop appearing. Therefore, after closing this instance, any thread(s) that are blocked polling for new data may need to be woken up via Thread.interrupt().

        Returns:
        queue of NestedChannelRequest initiated from the remote side

      • close

        void close()
    throws IOException
        Close this instance.

        All outstanding nested channels are also implicitly closed.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Channel

        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
